sample_texts: I'm going to the store to get some aluminum foil, a schedule for the theater, and water. Can you believe it's already the fourth quarter? Let me grab my cell phone and we'll be all set.
Hey there! I'm from the United States and I love to eat cookies while watching movies at the theater. My favorite color is gray and I drive on the freeway every day.
Water, aluminum, schedule, theater, elevator, apartment, garbage, vacation, pants, mom, awesome, totally, like really cool stuff.
The American pronunciation includes words like aluminum instead of aluminium, and we say zee instead of zed for the letter Z.
I work in a corporation downtown and take the elevator to the twentieth floor every morning for my job in marketing.
description: American English accent from the United States with characteristic pronunciation patterns including rhoticity and specific vowel sounds.
